lead_paragraph: Houston Rockets guard Rafer Alston was charged yesterday with slashing a man’s neck during a ruckus at a Manhattan nightclub — his second brush with the law this month. The police arrested Alston early Monday after responding to a brawl at a nightclub.Alston, 31, was arraigned on felony assault charges before being released without bail. A judge ordered him to return to court Jan. 3.Alston’s lawyer, Alberto Ebanks, said he was “absolutely innocent.”Alston, who grew up in Queens, was ordered to return to court Jan. 3. His lawyer did not respond to a telephone message.The arrest came three weeks after Alston was charged with misdemeanor assault and public intoxication in Houston.
